title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The minimal response to earn the point is 9+20 ⋅ 0.4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI5aGaey4kaSIaaGOmai aaicdacaaMe8oeaaaaaaaaa8qacqGHflY1caaMe8+daiaaicdacaGG UaGaaGina8qacaGGUaaaaa@3ECE@

This numerical response does not need to be simplified but if simplification is attempted, it must be correct to earn this point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

We must see at a minimum a difference in either the numerator OR denominator before any simplification. For example, 84−20 0.4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaalaaapa qaa8qacaaI4aGaaGinaiabgkHiTiaaikdacaaIWaaapaqaa8qacaaI WaGaaiOlaiaaisdaaaaaaa@39AF@ or 64 2.4−2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaalaaapa qaa8qacaaI2aGaaGinaaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaiaac6cacaaI0aGaeyOe I0IaaGOmaaaacaGGUaaaaa@39A7@

These expressions do not need to be simplified but any additional simplification must be correct.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The minimal response to earn both points is 2 ⋅ 9 ⋅ 20. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdapa GaaGjbV=qacqGHflY1caaMe8UaaGyoa8aacaaMe8+dbiabgwSixlaa ysW7caaIYaGaaGimaiaac6caaaa@4201@

The first point is for the correct application of the chain rule to produce the derivative h ′  ( x )=2 ⋅ g ( x ) ⋅  g ′  ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbauaacaaMi8+aae WaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0JaaGOmaiaaysW7qaaa aaaaaaWdbiabgwSixlaaysW7caWGNbGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaa GaayjkaiaawMcaa8aacaaMe8+dbiabgwSixlaaysW7ceWGNbGbauaa caaMi8+aaeWaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaaiOlaaaa@4FD1@

For the first point it is possible that a student expands the expression as a product and uses the product rule instead. If this is done correctly, the student would earn the first point and be eligible for the second point.

The answer point is earned only by the correct answer 2 ⋅ 9 ⋅ 20. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdapa GaaGjbV=qacqGHflY1caaMe8UaaGyoa8aacaaMe8+dbiabgwSixlaa ysW7caaIYaGaaGimaiaac6caaaa@4201@ This answer does not need to be simplified but any simplification must be correct.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The minimal response to earn the point is 39 ⋅ 0.2+71 ⋅ 0.2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIZaGaaGyoaiaaysW7qa aaaaaaaaWdbiabgwSixlaaysW7caaIWaGaaiOlaiaaikdapaGaey4k aSIaaG4naiaaigdacaaMe8+dbiabgwSixlaaysW7caaIWaGaaiOlai aaikdaaaa@4669@ or ( 39+71 ) ⋅ 0.2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaabmaapa qaa8qacaaIZaGaaGyoaiabgUcaRiaaiEdacaaIXaaacaGLOaGaayzk aaWdaiaaysW7peGaeyyXICTaaGjbVlaaicdacaGGUaGaaGOmaiaac6 caaaa@4137@

As always, the numerical answer does not need to be simplified, but if simplification is attempted, it must be correct.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

General:

The first point is for concluding that g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is concave down given that g ‴ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@36FD@ is negative.

The answer point is earned for using that g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is concave down on the given interval to conclude that the midpoint Riemann sum approximation of ∫ 2 2.4 g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaapedaba Gabm4zayaafaGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaa ykW7caaMc8UaamizaiaadIhaaSqaaiaaikdaaeaacaaIYaGaaiOlai aaisdaa0Gaey4kIipaaaa@426F@ computed in part (d) must necessarily be an overestimate.

Responses that fail to mention g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ but instead use ambiguous language such as “the function,” “the graph,” or “it” earn one out of the two points if the response is correct when the ambiguous term is replaced by g ′  ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGa aiOlaaaa@3953@

Responses that only discuss the increasing behavior of g ″ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Gbamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@36F1@ do not earn either point. The student must bring the discussion down to a consideration about g ′  ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGa aiOlaaaa@3953@

Responses that conclude the approximation is an underestimate cannot earn the answer point.

First point:

We are looking for the response to reach a conclusion regarding g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaaMi8+aae WaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3843@ based on the information they are given regarding g ‴ ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaaiOlaaaa@37AF@

Responses must involve the concavity of g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ either by explicitly using the word “concavity” in connection with of g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ or implicitly by clearly discussing the concavity of g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ in graphical terms. For example:

· “Since g ‴ ( x )<0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyipaWJaaGim aiaacYcaaaa@396C@ then g ″ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Gbamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@36F1@ is decreasing so…” does not earn the first point, because it does not discuss the concavity of g ′  ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGa aiOlaaaa@3953@

· “Since g ‴ ( x )<0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyipaWJaaGim aiaacYcaaaa@396C@ the tangent line to the graph of g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaaMi8+aae WaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3843@ lies above g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaaMi8+aae WaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3843@ so…” does earn the first point, because it discusses the concavity of g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaaMi8+aae WaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3843@ implicitly.

Responses often conclude from the table of values that g ′ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@3710@ is increasing, and we are willing to overlook this assertion (which may or may not be valid) unless their discussion implies that this is part of the condition of the conclusion. This can impact whether a response earns the first and/or second points. For example:

· “Since g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is increasing and g ‴ ( x )<0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyipaWJaaGim aiaacYcaaaa@396C@ g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaiaayIW7daqadaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@3882@ is concave down.” This does not earn the first point, because it implies that “ g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is increasing” is part of the condition on the concavity of g ′  ( x ). Since it is also increasing, the approximation is an overestimate.” This earns only the first point, because “it” is inferred to mean g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ and this implies that “ g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is increasing” is part of the rationale for the answer point.

· “The approximation is an overestimate because g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is increasing and concave down.” This earns only the first point, because it implies that “ g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapa GbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaa aa@38A1@ is increasing” is part of the rationale for the answer point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The first point is awarded for a response that provides clear evidence of an understanding of Euler’s method, presented either in a table or in the form shown in the model solution. This requires that there is at most one incorrect value in the first step of the approximation 9+20 ⋅ 0.2=13. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaiMdacq GHRaWkcaaIYaGaaGima8aacaaMe8+dbiabgwSixlaaysW7caaIWaGa aiOlaiaaikdacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGaaG4maiaac6caaaa@414A@

Once a response earns the first point, any subsequent errors will mean the answer point is not earned.

The answer point is earned only if the first point was earned, and the numerical answer of 24.2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaGinaiaac6caca aIYaaaaa@361C@ or an equivalent is reported.

The numerical answer does not need to be simplified. For example, 9+20 ⋅ 0.2+56 ⋅ 0.2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI5aGaey4kaSIaaGOmai aaicdacaaMe8oeaaaaaaaaa8qacqGHflY1caaMe8UaaGimaiaac6ca caaIYaGaey4kaSIaaGynaiaaiAdapaGaaGjbV=qacqGHflY1caaMe8 UaaGimaiaac6cacaaIYaaaaa@4807@ would earn both points.

Tabular responses:

Tabular responses are common and will generally be some variant of the following (although not all of the columns need to necessarily be included):

In the presence of correct values in the table above, the column headings do not need to be labeled. However, any error in an unlabeled table will earn no points in this problem.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is for producing any two terms of the third-degree Taylor polynomial, and the second point is for combining these with the remaining terms into a third-degree polynomial centered at x=2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGOmai aac6caaaa@36A5@

Because g ″ ( 2 )=200 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Gbamaabmaapaqaa8qacaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0JaaGOm aiaaicdacaaIWaaaaa@39E7@ and g ‴ ( 2 )=−200 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0JaeyOe I0IaaGOmaiaaicdacaaIWaaaaa@3ADF@ are given explicitly in the statement of the question in part (g), the student need not substitute these numerical values for g ″ ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Gbamaabmaapaqaa8qacaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@36B1@ and g ‴ ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Geamaabmaapaqaa8qacaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@36BC@ in the coefficients of the Taylor polynomial expression. However, the student must use the numerical values g ( 2 )=9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaca aMi8+aaeWaa8aabaWdbiaaikdaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqpcaaI 5aaaaa@39FE@ given in the initial statement of the problem and g ′  ( 2 )=20 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaiaayIW7daqadaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabg2da 9iaaikdacaaIWaaaaa@3ABD@ from the table for the coefficients involving those values. For example:

· The expression g( 2 )+ g ′  ( 2 )( x−2 )+ g ″ ( 2 ) 2! ( x−2 ) 2 + g ‴ ( 2 ) 3! ( x−2 ) 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgada qadaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRiqadEgapaGb auaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaWaae Waa8aabaWdbiaadIhacqGHsislcaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaey4k aSYaaSaaa8aabaWdbiqadEgagaGbamaabmaapaqaa8qacaaIYaaaca GLOaGaayzkaaaapaqaa8qacaaIYaGaaiyiaaaadaqadaWdaeaapeGa amiEaiabgkHiTiaaikdaaiaawIcacaGLPaaapaWaaWbaaSqabeaape GaaGOmaaaakiabgUcaRmaalaaapaqaa8qaceWGNbGbaibadaqadaWd aeaapeGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaWdaeaapeGaaG4maiaacgcaaa WaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhacqGHsislcaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaWd amaaCaaaleqabaWdbiaaiodaaaaaaa@5780@ earns only one point.

· The expression 9+20( x−2 )+ g ″ ( 2 ) 2! ( x−2 ) 2 + g ‴ ( 2 ) 3! ( x−2 ) 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaiMdacq GHRaWkcaaIYaGaaGimamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4bGaeyOeI0IaaGOm aaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRmaalaaapaqaa8qaceWGNbGbayaada qadaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaiaa cgcaaaWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhacqGHsislcaaIYaaacaGLOaGaay zkaaWdamaaCaaaleqabaWdbiaaikdaaaGccqGHRaWkdaWcaaWdaeaa peGabm4zayaasaWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaaikdaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaa8 aabaWdbiaaiodacaGGHaaaamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4bGaeyOeI0Ia aGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8aadaahaaWcbeqaa8qacaaIZaaaaaaa@515D@ earns both points.

Coefficients that are presented in decimal form must be correct to three decimal places, rounded or truncated.

All variable names (t, x, y, …) are acceptable as long as that variable is used correctly in all non-constant terms.

Coefficients need not be simplified.
